values.description: I created a lightweight ModelPluginThrottled class that adds the ability to specify the update rate of the plugin. For now, the functionality is there but I haven't touched the real update rate of each plugin. We can tweak it later based on experimentation.
values.title: Throttle plugins

summary.raw: I created a lightweight ModelPluginThrottled class that adds the ability to specify the update rate of the plugin. For now, the functionality is there but I haven't touched the real update rate of each plugin. We can tweak it later based on experimentation.

values.reason: I'll decline this PR for now, as it's not critical.

values.description:
This is mostly just deleting dead code, removing unused/broken files, and following ROS conventions. Note some of the file moves are appearing on Bitbucket as remove \+ add even though they were moved with hg move.

* Delete unused blender param files
* Delete unused/broken launch files in wamv\_description
* Delete dead code /references to old repositories this code was imported from
* Remove sensor joints from wamv\_base \(wamv\_base should just be the wamv IMO\)
* Move python nodes to nodes dir
*  Use xacro for world files to eliminate duplicate code
*  Move wamv\_robotx to robotx\_gazebo to remove circular dependency
* Remove platform specific features from wamv base
* Get model for quat2rpy by model name, not arbitrary index
* Give buoys names so duplicates can exist
* Build xacro files as install targets

‌
values.title: Various cleanups / refactors

values.description:
* Create package wamv\_gazebo for code for wamv gazebo code which is not specific to robotx
* Create package usv\_gazebo\_plugins for code not specific to the wamv or to robotx
* Remove unused PROPELLER.dae
* Move gazebo plugins to usv\_gazebo\_plugins
* Remove unsused buoyancy plugin \(already in gazebo\)
* Turn sandisland and navigation challenge into xacro macros, laying foundation for easily composing custom course worlds

‌

values.description:
List of highlights of this patch:

* WAM-V urdf is a bit more modular as we use two new xacro macros:

    * engine: Let us insert any engine into a specific position.
    * main\_collisions: Create the simple collision elements from one side. We can take advantage of the symmetry of the model to create the other side automatically.
    
* The propeller is a different link connected with a continuous joint to the engine shaft. We can now spin the propellers.
* Thrust\_plugin modified to spin the propellers.

If you teleoperate the model, you should see the propellers spinning.

**Question**: I don’t have an intuition about the right directions to spin the propellers when moving forward. Let me know if I should flip the sign.
values.title: WAM-V v2

summary.raw:
List of highlights of this patch:

* WAM-V urdf is a bit more modular as we use two new xacro macros:

    * engine: Let us insert any engine into a specific position.
    * main\_collisions: Create the simple collision elements from one side. We can take advantage of the symmetry of the model to create the other side automatically.
    
* The propeller is a different link connected with a continuous joint to the engine shaft. We can now spin the propellers.
* Thrust\_plugin modified to spin the propellers.

If you teleoperate the model, you should see the propellers spinning.

**Question**: I don’t have an intuition about the right directions to spin the propellers when moving forward. Let me know if I should flip the sign.
summary.html:
List of highlights of this patch:

  • WAM-V urdf is a bit more modular as we use two new xacro macros:

    • engine: Let us insert any engine into a specific position.
    • main_collisions: Create the simple collision elements from one side. We can take advantage of the symmetry of the model to create the other side automatically.

  • The propeller is a different link connected with a continuous joint to the engine shaft. We can now spin the propellers.

  • Thrust_plugin modified to spin the propellers.

If you teleoperate the model, you should see the propellers spinning.

Question: I don’t have an intuition about the right directions to spin the propellers when moving forward. Let me know if I should flip the sign.

values.description: It seemed confusing to have to run a separate node for the light\_buoy to work, so I moved it into a gazebo plugin started automatically when the model is spawned. So now the light buoy can just be included into a world file like the other models.
values.title: Move light_buoy controller to gazebo plugin

summary.raw: It seemed confusing to have to run a separate node for the light\_buoy to work, so I moved it into a gazebo plugin started automatically when the model is spawned. So now the light buoy can just be included into a world file like the other models.
summary.html: It seemed confusing to have to run a separate node for the light_buoy to work, so I moved it into a gazebo plugin started automatically when the model is spawned. So now the light buoy can just be included into a world file like the other models.

values.description:
* Create xacro macros for common WAMV-V sensors \(imu, gps, camera, planar lidar\), based on @brian\_bingham ’s nps\_robotx package.
* Add an example urdf using these macros \(again from nps\_robotx\)
* Add an example localization launch file which uses ROS’s ekf package to fuse imu and gps into a state estimation
* Publish joint states from thrust plugin so rviz can visualize the propellers
* Added an example rviz config / launch file to see the sensors and tf tree and test the localization

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/637660744-2018-06-28_11-56-12.gif)
‌
values.title: Add sensor macros and example

summary.html:
Minor tweaks to align the code with Gazebo style guidelines.

@brian_bingham , I marked some doxygen comments in usv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.h as ToDo. Do you mind to replace the ToDo tags and complete the explanation of the allowed SDF parameters? You can explain better than me these params.

Question: I see in wamv_gazebo/urdf/wamv_gazebo_thrust_plugin.xacro a parameter named boatArea that is not parsed in the plugin. Is this parameter missing in the plugin or on the other hand is not needed anymore and we should remove it from the xacro file?

values.description:
* new branch for small reorg
* cleaning up way light buoy is instantiated in example\_course.world

‌

Because light\_buoy is added explicitly within the example\_course.world.xacro, eems that the macros.xacro file was redundant, so replaced it with the original sandisland.xacro include. Also removed light\_buoy.xacro file since it is included explicitly in world file.

‌

values.description:
Address issue #12, using a series of boxes to simplify the collision model for sandisland. The collision is not very accurate, but I suspect it won’t matter too much. This should increase performance, especially with 3D laser scan sensors we will be adding soon.

‌

Also reindented some of the xml in the model for sandisland and ocean, as the alignment made it difficult to read. 2 spaces per level seems to be a good convention

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2731429166-sandislandcollisions.png)
values.title: Simplify sandisland collision

values.description:
The `surmark46104` is the original buoy \(white\). All colored totem buoys are based on this one with a cover \(a new visual\) on top. This way we only maintain one version of the buoy. It should have good inertia properties and simple shapes for collisions.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3346813969-totems.png)
values.title: Add totem buoys

summary.raw:
The `surmark46104` is the original buoy \(white\). All colored totem buoys are based on this one with a cover \(a new visual\) on top. This way we only maintain one version of the buoy. It should have good inertia properties and simple shapes for collisions.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3346813969-totems.png)
summary.html: The surmark46104 is the original buoy (white). All colored totem buoys are based on this one with a cover (a new visual) on top. This way we only maintain one version of the buoy. It should have good inertia properties and simple shapes for collisions.

values.description:
This PR introduces the following features:

* A new `dock_block` model. This is a static model of the modular floating dock used to build the RobotX docks. It has a simple box as a collision shape. I didn’t add any inertial properties as we’ll create static docks to avoid physics instabilities among all blocks.
* A new `dock_generator.erb` used to generate docks based on a string. As examples, I’ve generated the RobotX 2016 and 2018 docks. I’ll create a tutorial describing how to create a new dock but the process can be summarized as:

    * Create a new directory under `robotx_gazebo/models`with the name of your dock.
    * Create a `model.config`file.
    * Create a `model.sdf.erb` file using the template from `dock_2016/model.sdf.erb` or `dock_2018_model.sdf.erb`.
    * Modify the `laout` variable with the shape that you want to create.
    * Add the name of your new `erb` file to the `robotx_gazebo/CMakeLists.txt`section in which we add the list of model files to be processed by erb.
    

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3052397381-docks.png)
values.title: Dock

summary.raw:
This PR introduces the following features:

* A new `dock_block` model. This is a static model of the modular floating dock used to build the RobotX docks. It has a simple box as a collision shape. I didn’t add any inertial properties as we’ll create static docks to avoid physics instabilities among all blocks.
* A new `dock_generator.erb` used to generate docks based on a string. As examples, I’ve generated the RobotX 2016 and 2018 docks. I’ll create a tutorial describing how to create a new dock but the process can be summarized as:

    * Create a new directory under `robotx_gazebo/models`with the name of your dock.
    * Create a `model.config`file.
    * Create a `model.sdf.erb` file using the template from `dock_2016/model.sdf.erb` or `dock_2018_model.sdf.erb`.
    * Modify the `laout` variable with the shape that you want to create.
    * Add the name of your new `erb` file to the `robotx_gazebo/CMakeLists.txt`section in which we add the list of model files to be processed by erb.
    

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3052397381-docks.png)
summary.html:
This PR introduces the following features:

  • A new dock_block model. This is a static model of the modular floating dock used to build the RobotX docks. It has a simple box as a collision shape. I didn’t add any inertial properties as we’ll create static docks to avoid physics instabilities among all blocks.

  • A new dock_generator.erb used to generate docks based on a string. As examples, I’ve generated the RobotX 2016 and 2018 docks. I’ll create a tutorial describing how to create a new dock but the process can be summarized as:

    • Create a new directory under robotx_gazebo/modelswith the name of your dock.
    • Create a model.configfile.
    • Create a model.sdf.erb file using the template from dock_2016/model.sdf.erb or dock_2018_model.sdf.erb.
    • Modify the laout variable with the shape that you want to create.
    • Add the name of your new erb file to the robotx_gazebo/CMakeLists.txtsection in which we add the list of model files to be processed by erb.

values.description:
Verified issue #24 on two separate machines - both updated and clean clones of default branch.

The problem seems to be in defining the simplified collision model for the underwater topology.  I’m not sure why replacing the heightmap with a set of boxes causes Gazebo to hang?

Is the computational savings worth trying to sort this out?
values.title: Changing bathymetry model to address issue #24.

summary.raw:
Verified issue #24 on two separate machines - both updated and clean clones of default branch.

The problem seems to be in defining the simplified collision model for the underwater topology.  I’m not sure why replacing the heightmap with a set of boxes causes Gazebo to hang?

Is the computational savings worth trying to sort this out?
summary.html:
Verified issue #24 on two separate machines - both updated and clean clones of default branch.

The problem seems to be in defining the simplified collision model for the underwater topology. I’m not sure why replacing the heightmap with a set of boxes causes Gazebo to hang?

Is the computational savings worth trying to sort this out?

values.reason: Kevin fixed the issue by making sure to increment the Gazebo version to 7.13.1

values.description:
Add models for the 2016 and 2018 acoustic pinger/entrance gate challenges. Of course, this does not include the actual pinger but just the gate markers. Also fixes an issue with the totems where the cover falls off if not in the global scope.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3987428271-pinger_challenge_2016.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/150759173-2016pinger.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2169360100-2018pinger.png)
There is currently an issue with the 2018 version, because the light buoy is static the whole model does not respond to buoyancy and will stay partially submerged.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3695983814-2018_gate_challenge.png)
values.title: Pinger transit/ Entrace gate task

summary.raw:
Add models for the 2016 and 2018 acoustic pinger/entrance gate challenges. Of course, this does not include the actual pinger but just the gate markers. Also fixes an issue with the totems where the cover falls off if not in the global scope.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3987428271-pinger_challenge_2016.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/150759173-2016pinger.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2169360100-2018pinger.png)
There is currently an issue with the 2018 version, because the light buoy is static the whole model does not respond to buoyancy and will stay partially submerged.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3695983814-2018_gate_challenge.png)
summary.html:
Add models for the 2016 and 2018 acoustic pinger/entrance gate challenges. Of course, this does not include the actual pinger but just the gate markers. Also fixes an issue with the totems where the cover falls off if not in the global scope.

‌

‌

There is currently an issue with the 2018 version, because the light buoy is static the whole model does not respond to buoyancy and will stay partially submerged.

values.description:
Added the circle, cross and triangle symbols.

* The symbols are separate white models that can be reused in the future.
* All symbols are running a `gazebo_ros_color` plugin, so it’s possible to change its color via a ROS message.
* The placard is a new model with a white background and the three symbols. Note that the symbols are transparent, so none of them are visible by default.
* There's a `symbol_controller` plugin running in each placard to allow a fix configuration \(e.g. green circle\) or a random configuration. This plugin also accepts a service request to create a new random configuration.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/2377027615-placard.gif)
*Note: This pull request is built atop of pull request #27, which should be merged first.*
values.title: Symbols and placards

* All symbols are running a `gazebo_ros_color` plugin, so it’s possible to change its color via a ROS message.
* The placard is a new model with a white background and the three symbols. Note that the symbols are transparent, so none of them are visible by default.
* There's a `symbol_controller` plugin running in each placard to allow a fix configuration \(e.g. green circle\) or a random configuration. This plugin also accepts a service request to create a new random configuration.

summary.html:
Added the circle, cross and triangle symbols.

  • The symbols are separate white models that can be reused in the future.
  • All symbols are running a gazebo_ros_color plugin, so it’s possible to change its color via a ROS message.
  • The placard is a new model with a white background and the three symbols. Note that the symbols are transparent, so none of them are visible by default.
  • There's a symbol_controller plugin running in each placard to allow a fix configuration (e.g. green circle) or a random configuration. This plugin also accepts a service request to create a new random configuration.

Note: This pull request is built atop of pull request #27, which should be merged first.

values.description:
As we discussed - refactored thrust plugin to be more flexible.  Current setup has two defined thrusters with separate topics to provide commands to each thruster.  This should make it much easier to extend to other thruster configurations:

1. adding thruster articulation for vectored thrust
2. adding a lateral/bow thruster
3. changing to the four thruster “holonomic” configuration

This also gets rid of our custom UsvDrive message!

Once PR is good to go, then I’ll make some small changes to the tutorial and put together and example or two of other thruster configurations.

Commits:

* first steps towards new structure
* increment, pushing to work from home
* increment - builds, but need to go home
* prior to splitting thruster into its own header
* working prototype - next remove old method
* props now spinning, removed old method of thrust implementation, removed custome UsvDrive message
* refactor driving examples for new thrust structure
* changing some of the file names to be a bit more explanatory
values.title: Generalize thruster desc

values.description:
This makes use of the new thruster plugin structure to generate two additional propulsion configurations.   See [tutorial](#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/PropulsionConfiguration) for demonstration and a brief explanation.

The URDF/xacro setup is a  bit clunky - adding a new configuration requires making four new xacro files with only small changes.  E.g., for the “T” configuration we need:

* Define new URDF/xacro definition  [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_gazebo/urdf/wamv\_gazebo\_t.urdf.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/wamv_gazebo_t.urdf.xacro) that includes

    1. New visual definition that adds additional thruster, eg., [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_description/urdf/wamv\_t\_thrusters.urdf.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_description/urdf/wamv_t_thrusters.urdf.xacro)
    2. New definition of plugins and sensors [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_gazebo/urdf/macros\_t.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/macros_t.xacro) that includes
    
        * New thrust plugin definition that has an additional thruster section to the configuration of the thruster plugin to specify the link where force is applied, thrust command topic name, etc. [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_gazebo/urdf/dynamics/wamv\_gazebo\_thrust\_plugin\_t.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/dynamics/wamv_gazebo_thrust_plugin_t.xacro)
        
    

The method of handling the thrust\_config argument in the [launch file](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/robotx_gazebo/launch/sandisland.launch) is also a bit kludgy.  

As an example of other configuration options, I think it works, but would certainly be happy if someone wanted to improve for less redundancy in the xacro files.

* Created new branch holonomic-example
* adding examples for T and X thruster configurations - accessible as args to sandisland.launch. Prototype - too much redundancy in the various urdf.xacro file hierarchy, but functional.
* adding blank world for photo shoot of propulsion
values.title: Holonomic example

summary.raw:
This makes use of the new thruster plugin structure to generate two additional propulsion configurations.   See [tutorial](#!/osrf/vmrc/wiki/tutorials/PropulsionConfiguration) for demonstration and a brief explanation.

The URDF/xacro setup is a  bit clunky - adding a new configuration requires making four new xacro files with only small changes.  E.g., for the “T” configuration we need:

* Define new URDF/xacro definition  [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_gazebo/urdf/wamv\_gazebo\_t.urdf.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/wamv_gazebo_t.urdf.xacro) that includes

    1. New visual definition that adds additional thruster, eg., [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_description/urdf/wamv\_t\_thrusters.urdf.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_description/urdf/wamv_t_thrusters.urdf.xacro)
    2. New definition of plugins and sensors [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_gazebo/urdf/macros\_t.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/macros_t.xacro) that includes
    
        * New thrust plugin definition that has an additional thruster section to the configuration of the thruster plugin to specify the link where force is applied, thrust command topic name, etc. [#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv\_gazebo/urdf/dynamics/wamv\_gazebo\_thrust\_plugin\_t.xacro](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/dynamics/wamv_gazebo_thrust_plugin_t.xacro)
        
    

The method of handling the thrust\_config argument in the [launch file](#!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/robotx_gazebo/launch/sandisland.launch) is also a bit kludgy.  

As an example of other configuration options, I think it works, but would certainly be happy if someone wanted to improve for less redundancy in the xacro files.

* Created new branch holonomic-example
* adding examples for T and X thruster configurations - accessible as args to sandisland.launch. Prototype - too much redundancy in the various urdf.xacro file hierarchy, but functional.
* adding blank world for photo shoot of propulsion
summary.html:
This makes use of the new thruster plugin structure to generate two additional propulsion configurations. See tutorial for demonstration and a brief explanation.

The URDF/xacro setup is a bit clunky - adding a new configuration requires making four new xacro files with only small changes. E.g., for the “T” configuration we need:

  • Define new URDF/xacro definition #!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/wamv_gazebo_t.urdf.xacro that includes

    1. New visual definition that adds additional thruster, eg., #!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_description/urdf/wamv_t_thrusters.urdf.xacro

    2. New definition of plugins and sensors #!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/macros_t.xacro that includes

      • New thrust plugin definition that has an additional thruster section to the configuration of the thruster plugin to specify the link where force is applied, thrust command topic name, etc. #!/osrf/vmrc/src/holonomic-example/wamv_gazebo/urdf/dynamics/wamv_gazebo_thrust_plugin_t.xacro

The method of handling the thrust_config argument in the launch file is also a bit kludgy.

As an example of other configuration options, I think it works, but would certainly be happy if someone wanted to improve for less redundancy in the xacro files.

  • Created new branch holonomic-example
  • adding examples for T and X thruster configurations - accessible as args to sandisland.launch. Prototype - too much redundancy in the various urdf.xacro file hierarchy, but functional.
  • adding blank world for photo shoot of propulsion

values.description:
* Add xacro macro to spawn a 3D scanning lidar similar to the velodyne VLP-16 simulated with gazebo’s gpu\_ray sensor. It uses the velodyne\_simulator package for the ROS interface.
* Modify example model with sensors to use 3D laser instead of planar

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/885766324-3dlidar.png)
This is somewhat useful now, but there are some issues:

* The ocean will reflect the laser beams perfectly, consuming much of the output
* Performance is still quite bad even with GPU. This may be due to the above issue.
values.title: Add 3D laser xacro

summary.raw:
* Add xacro macro to spawn a 3D scanning lidar similar to the velodyne VLP-16 simulated with gazebo’s gpu\_ray sensor. It uses the velodyne\_simulator package for the ROS interface.
* Modify example model with sensors to use 3D laser instead of planar

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/885766324-3dlidar.png)
This is somewhat useful now, but there are some issues:

* The ocean will reflect the laser beams perfectly, consuming much of the output
* Performance is still quite bad even with GPU. This may be due to the above issue.
summary.html:
• Add xacro macro to spawn a 3D scanning lidar similar to the velodyne VLP-16 simulated with gazebo’s gpu_ray sensor. It uses the velodyne_simulator package for the ROS interface.
  • Modify example model with sensors to use 3D laser instead of planar

This is somewhat useful now, but there are some issues:

  • The ocean will reflect the laser beams perfectly, consuming much of the output
  • Performance is still quite bad even with GPU. This may be due to the above issue.

values.description:
Sensor suite:

* Stereo camera in the front
* Lateral camera pointing right
* GPS
* IMU
* 3D lidar

I’m assuming that we’ll tweak the sensor specs in the future, but this is the starting point. The rviz config file has been also updated.

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3349778903-rviz.png)

values.description:
Add spherical coordinates to the sandisland world, so gps sensors will report the correct lat/long. That lat/long I picked is a very rough estimate from google maps, but better than the default 0/0.

‌

Edit: Looks like the gps macro in wamv\_gazebo has a reference lat/long so it will work, but this is helpful for users implementing custom gps plugins \(such as for a combined GPS/INS for my team\).
values.title: Add spherical coordinates for sandisland

values.description:
* Initial commit of proposed pinger plugin.
* Fix pinger .xacro file. Add citation and remove collision.

Hi There,

Here is an initial implementation of an accoustic pinger plugin for issue #26.

This also includes a small python script that moves the apparent pinger position between three possible locations., and publishes a corresponding RViz marker.

I am happy to refactor this if necessary.

Regards,

Jonathan Wheare
values.title: Default

summary.raw:
* Initial commit of proposed pinger plugin.
* Fix pinger .xacro file. Add citation and remove collision.

Hi There,

Here is an initial implementation of an accoustic pinger plugin for issue #26.

This also includes a small python script that moves the apparent pinger position between three possible locations., and publishes a corresponding RViz marker.

I am happy to refactor this if necessary.

Regards,

Jonathan Wheare
summary.html:
• Initial commit of proposed pinger plugin.
  • Fix pinger .xacro file. Add citation and remove collision.

Hi There,

Here is an initial implementation of an accoustic pinger plugin for issue #26.

This also includes a small python script that moves the apparent pinger position between three possible locations., and publishes a corresponding RViz marker.

I am happy to refactor this if necessary.

Regards,

Jonathan Wheare

summary.html:
This pull request renames robotx_gazebo to vmrc_gazebo and does some small cleaning.

@brian_bingham , I removed you from the maintainer role unless you’re interested. This task involves dealing with the ROS build farms and future syncs. Totally up to you :)

Update: I removed the vmrc metapackage as it's not needed. Installing vmrc_gazebo should install all the required software.
